alert.note: Alert for Montgomery; Treutlen; Wheeler (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 13 at 10:48AM EDT until April 16 at 2:00PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Georgia... Oconee River near Mount Vernon affecting Treutlen, Wheeler and Montgomery Counties. For the Oconee River Basin...including Penfield, Milledgeville, Oconee, Oconee, McIntyre, Big Sandy Creek at US 441 near Irwinton, Oconee, Dublin, Mount Vernon...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY SATURDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast to continue. * WHERE...Oconee River near Mount Vernon. * WHEN...Until early Saturday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Between 18 and 19 feet, Minor flooding expands in the woodlands and pastures upstream and downstream from the gage on U.S. Highway 280. A campground and a few out buildings begin to flood several miles south of Mount Vernon. Eleven homes in the Cherokee Sand Ridge subdivision are surrounded by water. Dead River Road becomes flooded and is closed. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:45 AM EDT Wednesday the stage was 18.8 feet and steady. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:45 AM EDT Wednesday was 18.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage Saturday morning and continue falling to 11.2 feet Monday morning. - Flood stage is 16 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 18.8 feet on 02/09/1996. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta.
